intro: Paraprenanthes oligolepis, commonly known as the slender sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family, characterized by its small, tubular flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its botanical features make it a unique and resilient species in its native habitat.
